definition: to settle (a dispute out of court)/to reconcile/settlement/conciliation/to become reconciled
and/together with/with/sum/union/peace/harmony/Taiwan pr. [han4] when it means "and" or "with"
surname He/Japanese (food, clothes etc)
to combine a powdery substance (flour, plaster etc) with water/Taiwan pr. [huo4]
to complete a set in mahjong or playing cards
to compose a poem in reply (to sb's poem) using the same rhyme sequence/to join in the singing/to chime in with others
to mix (ingredients) together/to blend/classifier for rinses of clothes/classifier for boilings of medicinal herbs
acrobatic display (esp. on horseback) (old)/variant of 懈[xie4] and 邂[xie4] (old)
surname Xie
to divide/to break up/to split/to separate/to dissolve/to solve/to melt/to remove/to untie/to loosen/to open/to emancipate/to explain/to understand/to know/a solution/a dissection
to transport under guard
money settlement (fine or payment to end a legal dispute)

sentences.english: The two companies settled out of court.
sentences.chinese: 這兩家公司在庭外和解了。

sentences.english: They had a fight, but they have already made up.
sentences.chinese: 他們打過一架，不過他們已經和解了。

sentences.english: Ganesha advises them to consider the sweet rewards of compromise.
sentences.chinese: 象頭神創議他們多想想和解之後的甜美生。

sentences.english: They settled the case out of court .
sentences.chinese: 他們的案子在庭外和解了。

sentences.english: Fighting fire with fire without reconciliation and healing will never solve the problem.
sentences.chinese: 以火攻火，不能和解和癒合，絕難解決問題。

sentences.english: One afternoon I drove out from Jaipur in a final attempt at reconciliation.
sentences.chinese: 一天中午，我開車離開齋浦爾，做最後的和解努力。

sentences.english: Causes the NGU pathogen mainly for the blister mantle bacteria reconciliation urine mycoplasma.
sentences.chinese: 引起NGU的病原體主要爲沙眼衣原體和解尿支原體。

sentences.english: She is coming to make up with you.
Abe told reporters after the talks that the countries made a "first step" toward reconciliation.
sentences.chinese: 會談後，安倍對記者說，兩國朝和解邁出了第一步。

sentences.english: Ascertainable effect is the essential content of a compromise contract.
sentences.chinese: 和解合同的典型內容爲確定效力。

sentences.english: A bad compromise is better than a good suit.
sentences.chinese: 喫虧的和解強似勝利的訴訟。

sentences.english: The crisis trends toward a reconciliation.
Continuing to encourage reconciliation with tribal leaders and government officials.
sentences.chinese: 繼續鼓勵部落首領與政府官員之間的和解。

sentences.english: Reconciliation on the Korean Peninsula is moving haltingly.
sentences.chinese: 朝鮮半島和解進程依然曲折。

sentences.english: Like decisions not to prosecute, settlements tend to be ill-suited to judicial supervision .
sentences.chinese: 和不提起公訴的決定一樣，和解趨於不適宜司法監督。

definition: to compromise/to reach terms/a compromise
to mediate/to bring parties to an agreement
to reconcile/to mediate/to bring warring parties to agreement/to arbitrate
lit. to exchange weapons of war for gifts of jade and silk (idiom)/fig. to turn hostility into friendship
pinyin: hua4 gan1 ge1 wei2 yu4 bo2

definition: to become reconciled/to bury the hatchet
to rupture/to burst open/to break/to break off relations with/a rupture
dispute/controversy/conflict
to improve relations
to settle a dispute
to make peace/to reconcile
to mediate (a conflict etc)
to reach agreement
to consult with/to talk things over/agreement
to have an acrimonious falling-out/to shed all pretense of cordiality/to tear into each other
to form an alliance/to ally oneself with/allied with/aligned/to bond with
peace talks
